Plot a score overlaid on a supplied t-SNE or PCA generated using a cancer single-cell population expression matrix.

plot_scores.Rd

This function is a generic function for plotting a t-SNE or PCA previously generated using cancer single-cell population expression matrix. It can be used to label or colour individual or small groups of cells to assist identification of subpopulations of interest, e.g. groups of cancer stem cells.

plot_scores(
  myData,
  xAxisName,
  yAxisName,
  runName,
  scoresName,
  datasetName,
  outDir,
  labelPositions = NULL,
  colourPositions = NULL,
  highestOnTop = NULL
)

Arguments

myData

Data frame describing t-SNE or PCA and score/s including the score to print.
xAxisName

Name of column in myData that describes x-axis info for plot e.g. "Y1" in a t-SNE.
yAxisName

Name of column in myData that describes y-axis info for plot e.g. "Y2" in a t-SNE.
runName

Run name, e.g. 'tSNE_070'; will be used in the title of the plot and the output tif name.
scoresName

Name of column in myData that contains the score info for plotting e.g. 'ranger_hipsci_raw_IPS'.
datasetName

Name of dataset, e.g. 'mela_4558_TPM'.
outDir

Output directory to use.
labelPositions

Optional: Row number/s of myData i.e. cell positions, to print cell labels for.
colourPositions

Optional: Row number/s of myData i.e. cell positions, to highlight cells (in black).
highestOnTop

Optional: Set to TRUE to print highest scoring cells on top of lower scoring cells.

Value

No return value.
